title: SSC Delhi Police Constable (Executive) Recruitment 2025
eligibility: Matriculation (10th) Pass or equivalent from a recognized Board. Candidate must possess a valid Driving License for LMV (Motorcycle/Car) as on the closing date for receipt of application. Other physical and medical standards apply.
description: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) invites online applications for the post of Constable (Executive) in Delhi Police. This recruitment drive aims to fill a large number of vacancies for male and female candidates. The selection process involves a Computer Based Examination, Physical Endurance and Measurement Test (PE&MT), and Medical Examination.
responsibilities: Maintaining law and order in the assigned area.
Patrolling and preventing criminal activities.
Enforcing traffic rules and regulations.
Responding to emergencies and public calls for assistance.
Investigation of minor crimes and assisting senior officers.
Crowd control during public gatherings and events.
salary: Pay Level-3 (₹21,700 – ₹69,100) as per 7th CPC + allowances as admissible to Delhi Government employees.
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi (NCT of Delhi)
examvacancy: SSC Delhi Police Constable Vacancy 2025 Details

title: DSSSB Assistant Teacher (Primary) Recruitment 2025
eligibility: Senior Secondary (10+2) with at least 50% marks and 2-Year Diploma in Elementary Education (D.El.Ed) OR 10+2 with 45% marks and 2-Year D.El.Ed (as per NCTE Norms 2002) OR 10+2 with 50% marks and 4-Year B.El.Ed OR 10+2 with 50% marks and 2-Year Diploma in Education (Special Education) OR Graduation with 2-Year D.El.Ed AND Must have passed CTET (Paper I) with studied Hindi/Urdu/Punjabi/English at secondary level or equivalent eligibility from recognized University/Board.
description: DSSSB invites online applications for 1180 Assistant Teacher (Primary) posts under DoE and NDMC. Recruitment will be conducted through Computer Based Test (CBT) followed by Document Verification. This is a significant opportunity to teach primary-level students in Delhi government schools.
responsibilities: Teaching primary level students (Classes I–V)
Classroom management and lesson planning
Maintaining student records
Organizing co-curricular activities
Ensuring child development in line with curriculum standards
salary: Pay Level-6 (₹35,400 – ₹1,12,400) + allowances as per government norms

eligibility: Degree/Diploma in related field from a recognized University/Board/Institution in India
description: Bank of Maharashtra invites online applications for 350 Specialist Officer (SO) posts across various scales (Scale II to Scale VI). Selection includes Online Examination, Group Discussion/Interview, and Final Merit List.
responsibilities: Perform specialist banking roles based on domain expertise
Handle specific departmental functions
Contribute to strategic decision-making in the area of specialization
Lead teams and ensure adherence to banking norms and compliance
salary: ₹64,820 – ₹1,56,500 per month + allowances as per bank norms

title: Orissa High Court Junior Stenographer Recruitment 2025
eligibility: Bachelor’s Degree in any discipline + shorthand speed 80 wpm + typewriting speed 40 wpm + Knowledge of Computer Applications
description: High Court of Orissa invites online applications for 25 posts of Junior Stenographer (Group-C). Recruitment includes Qualifying Test in English, Computer Application Test, Skill Test, and Document Verification. Salary as per Level-7 Pay Matrix. Prestigious position involving court-stenography duties in Odisha.
responsibilities: Take dictation in shorthand and transcribe via typewriting/computer
Maintain accurate record of legal proceedings
Use computer applications for typing, word processing etc.
Ensure timely and error-free work in stenography and transcription
Follow court schedules and instructions, maintain confidentiality

eligibility: 10th Pass (Matriculation) from a recognized board + Valid LMV Driving Licence + 1 Year Driving Experience + Knowledge of Motor Mechanism. Age between 18-27 years as on 28 September 2025
